commit.message:
vxarm.h: Split out vxWorks support into separate headerfile and vxify.

        * arm/vxarm.h: Split out vxWorks support into separate headerfile
        and vxify.
        * arm/arm.c (cpu_defaults): Allow arm710 as default.
        * configure.in: Split out vxWorks support for Arm.
        * configure: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r25932

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,12 @@
+1999-01-23  Mike Stump  <mrs@wrs.com>
+
+	* arm/vxarm.h: Split out vxWorks support into separate headerfile
+	and vxify.
+	* arm/arm.c (cpu_defaults): Allow arm710 as default.
+	
+	* configure.in: Split out vxWorks support for Arm.
+	* configure: Rebuilt.
+
 Tue Mar 23 11:20:03 1999  Per Bothner  <bothner@cygnus.com>
 
 	* tree.c (first_rtl_op, has_cleanups):  Handle GOTO_SUBROUTINE_EXPR.

@@ -320,6 +320,7 @@ arm_override_options ()
 	{ TARGET_CPU_arm2,      "arm2" },
 	{ TARGET_CPU_arm6,      "arm6" },
 	{ TARGET_CPU_arm610,    "arm610" },
+	{ TARGET_CPU_arm710,	"arm710" },
 	{ TARGET_CPU_arm7m,     "arm7m" },
 	{ TARGET_CPU_arm7500fe, "arm7500fe" },
 	{ TARGET_CPU_arm7tdmi,  "arm7tdmi" },

@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+#undef SUBTARGET_CPP_SPEC
+#define SUBTARGET_CPP_SPEC      "%{march=arm710:-DCPU=ARM710A} \
+%{march=arm7tdmi:-DCPU=ARM7TDMI} \
+%{march=arm810:-DCPU=ARM810} \
+%{march=strongarm110:-DCPU=ARMSA110} \
+%{!march=*: \
+ %{mcpu=arm710:-DCPU=ARM710A} \
+ %{mcpu=arm7tdmi:-DCPU=ARM7TDMI} \
+ %{mcpu=arm810:-DCPU=ARM810} \
+ %{mcpu=strongarm110:-DCPU=ARMSA110}} \
+%{!mcpu*:%{!march=*:-DCPU=ARM710A}} \
+"
+
+#define SUBTARGET_CPU_DEFAULT TARGET_CPU_arm710
+
+#undef CPP_PREDEFINES
+#define CPP_PREDEFINES  "-D__vxworks -D__arm__ -Acpu(arm) -Amachine(arm)"
+
+/* VxWorks does all the library stuff itself.  */
+
+#undef LIB_SPEC
+#define LIB_SPEC ""
+
+/* VxWorks uses object files, not loadable images.  make linker just
+   combine objects. */
+
+#undef LINK_SPEC
+#define LINK_SPEC "-r"
+
+/* VxWorks provides the functionality of crt0.o and friends itself.  */
+
+#undef STARTFILE_SPEC
+#define STARTFILE_SPEC ""
+
+#undef ENDFILE_SPEC
+#define ENDFILE_SPEC ""

@@ -3035,6 +3035,10 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		tm_file=arm/coff.h
 		tmake_file=arm/t-bare
 		;;
+	arm-*-vxworks*)
+		tm_file="arm/coff.h arm/vxarm.h"
+		tmake_file=arm/t-bare
+		;;
 	arm-*-riscix1.[01]*)		# Acorn RISC machine (early versions)
 		tm_file=arm/riscix1-1.h
 		use_collect2=yes
@@ -5910,15 +5914,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5914: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:5918: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5922 "configure"
+#line 5926 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5929,7 +5933,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5933: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5937: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -5952,12 +5956,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5956: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:5960: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5961 "configure"
+#line 5965 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6006,7 +6010,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6010: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6014: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6027,21 +6031,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6031: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6035: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6038 "configure"
+#line 6042 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6045: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6049: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6067,12 +6071,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6071: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6075: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6076 "configure"
+#line 6080 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6100,12 +6104,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6104: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6108: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6109 "configure"
+#line 6113 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6135,19 +6139,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6139: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6143: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6144 "configure"
+#line 6148 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6151: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6155: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6168,12 +6172,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6172: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6176: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6177 "configure"
+#line 6181 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6201,7 +6205,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6205: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6209: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6233,12 +6237,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6237: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6241: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6242 "configure"
+#line 6246 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -6263,12 +6267,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6267: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6271: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6272 "configure"
+#line 6276 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6291,7 +6295,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6295: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6299: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6318,15 +6322,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6322: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6326: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then

 else

-#line 6330 "configure"

 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {

 EOF

+if { (eval echo configure:6353: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -6370,17 +6374,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6374: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6378: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5

 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6384: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6388: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6409,12 +6413,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6413: checking for $ac_func" >&5

 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6441: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6445: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6462,15 +6466,15 @@ fi

-echo "configure:6466: checking for working mmap" >&5
+echo "configure:6470: checking for working mmap" >&5

 }

+if { (eval echo configure:6618: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=yes
 else

 do

 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6642: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6646: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5

-#line 6647 "configure"

 EOF

-{ (eval echo configure:6652: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6656: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*

   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"

     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6

+if { (eval echo configure:6817: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*

-echo "configure:6834: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5

         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"

 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6854: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5

   withval="$with_included_gettext"

 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6873: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6877: checking for libintl.h" >&5

-{ (eval echo configure:6883: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6887: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }

 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6896,19 +6900,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6900: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:6904: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6905 "configure"
+#line 6909 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6912: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6916: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gettext_libc=yes
 else
